title: Crocodile bites man in the groin after he accidentally steps on it
text:
He was airlifted to hospital (Picture: AAPIMAGE/CareFlight)

A man was savaged in the leg by a crocodile after he accidentally stepped on it believing it was a log.

Elston Lami Lami, 42, had a near escape as the animal then went for his groin, shredding his shorts but avoiding serious injury.

He had been out hunting in murky water near Minjilang on Croker Island near Darwin, Australia, at 12.30pm on Saturday.

At first, the reptile stayed still beneath his foot until it suddenly lunged upwards and bit his upper right leg.

Mr Lama told local radio station ABC from a hospital bed: ‘When he come up, when he flipped me and I looked at his eye, he had that crocodile tears on it. Like… you’re mine. You’re my lunch.

‘I hit him three times in the nose, he let me go. Come back again, try and attack me. When he snapped at me, I grabbed him, held him at the jaw with two hands and I was getting weak so I thought the only way to get his attention, I had to hit him again.’ Elston Lami Lami being treated by medics (Picture: CareFlight) An Australian saltwater (Picture: AAP) Thankfully, his cousin was there to yell and distract the crocodile, as well as two dogs who barked at the reptile. He escaped with just two bites – but he still had to walk half an hour on his wounded leg back to his car. ‘Whatever pain I was going through, I didn’t want to show it to them boys, because I was the older one there,’ told the station. At the car, he took a few paracetamol tablets and bandaged himself up before heading to Minjilang Community Health Centre. He was then airlifted to Royal Darwin Hospital by Careflight, and will need to stay in hospital for several days before he can go home. Got a story for Metro.co.uk?
